item.title: Report X-2024041529
item.description:
Report X-2024041529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER DONNED PPE INCLUDING GLOVES, APRON, BOOTS, AND GOGGLES. THE RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECISION BEFORE CLEANING THE SPILL. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS WERE TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA. ALL CONTAMINATED MATERIALS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report I-2024100035
item.description:
Report I-2024100035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T00:36:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: BYERS
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING GP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 168184
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 29, 2023 at approximately 9:57 AM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on NW 70th St near Byers in Pratt County, KS to Plains Wellsford Station east of Wellsford, KS. The driver ran off the roadway (right) onto the earthen shoulder, went to correct to enter back onto roadway (left) when trailer turned sideways and with momentum laid over onto its side. Upon landing on its side a seam on the trailer body was punctured, creating a small hole and as result 14 gallons of crude oil was released onto the roadway and into the roadside ditch. The transport vehicle was non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. The roadway was cleaned and impacted roadside ditch was excavated to remove impacted soil and area graded to restore contouring. The Plains driver was injured and treated at Hutchison Regional Medical Center in Hutchison, KS.
